newsitem.title: GERMANY: Daimler to issue convertible notes.
newsitem.headline: Daimler to issue convertible notes.

text.p: Daimler-Benz AG said on Wednesday that in order to strengthen its capital base it will issue approximately 1.1 billion marks in mandatory convertible notes.
Daimler said that the instrument will be converted into Daimler shares in 2002 at the latest, when the issue reaches maturity.
Daimler Chief Financial Officer Manfred Gentz said in a statement that the company was issuing the notes because of the low level of interest rates and the positive stockmarket climate.
